title: Understanding the AVERAGE Function
text: The AVERAGE function is used to calculate the mean of a set of numbers. It takes a range of numbers, adds them together, and then divides the sum by the count of numbers in that range.

hintAnswer: takes in a range of numbers, adds them, and divides them by the number of cells with numeric values in the range
title: Breaking Down the AVERAGE Function
text: To find the average, you need to add all the numbers in the range and then divide by the number of numbers. For example, if you have the numbers $$2$$, $$4$$, and $$6$$, you would add them to get $$12$$, and then divide by $$3$$ to get $$4$$.
choices: takes in a range of numbers, adds them, and divides them by the number of cells with numeric values in the range
takes in a range of numbers, adds them, and divides them by the number of cells
takes in a number of cells, sums them, and divides them by their numeric values
